h1.style: font-family: sans-serif; width: 55%; float: left;text-align: left;

div.p: The Perl programming language was created by Larry Wall, who declared that the name was an abbreviation of Pathologically Eclectic Rubbish Lister, or possibly Practical Extraction and Report Language. I've used it a lot and I'm not ashamed of it. And I still use it. In spite of the fact that some people say it's dying. However, now when I'm more or less completetly converted to JAVA, we are actually discussing to switch part of our development to Ruby on Rails.

Digital Representation and the Text Model
Dino Buzzetti, 2002. Digital Representation and the Text Model. New Literary History, 33(1), p. 61-88.

Readings on digital objects: An annotated URIography
I have a long list of articles to read on digital objects, how to model them etc. This page is for keeping track of my progress

application/tei+xml
We are about to register a mime type for TEI. This page tracks the progress of that effort

A Safari among Subscription Libraries
I have been a subscriber to O'Reilly's Safari services for quite some years now. Recently I upgraded the subscription such that I get access to the entire stock without limitations.
